# Scale: Melodic in C (Mode: Melodic minor)

## Brief Presentation
The Melodic minor scale is a seven-note scale that differs from the natural minor scale by raising the sixth and seventh notes when ascending, while keeping the descending form the same as the natural minor scale. In the key of C, the Melodic minor scale consists of the following notes: C, D, Eb, F, G, A, B.

## Notes and Intervals
- C - Root
- D - Major 2nd
- Eb - Minor 3rd
- F - Perfect 4th
- G - Perfect 5th
- A - Major 6th
- B - Major 7th

## Genre and Musical Flavor
The Melodic minor scale is often used in jazz, fusion, and classical music. It has a unique sound that can evoke a sense of tension and release due to the augmented 2nd interval between the 6th and 7th degrees of the scale when ascending. This scale allows for various melodic possibilities, adding a touch of exoticism to compositions.
